definition: To liberate or set free from a situation, condition, or constraint, often involving the release from physical or emotional confinement. This term is commonly used to describe the act of freeing someone or something from captivity, oppression, or bondage. It can also refer to the act of relieving someone from a burden, such as freeing them from a difficult task or responsibility.

examples.german: Die Feuerwehr konnte die Katze aus dem Baum befreien.
examples.english: The fire department was able to free the cat from the tree.

examples.german: Die Gefangenen wurden endlich aus dem Gefängnis befreit.
examples.english: The prisoners were finally freed from the prison.

examples.german: Die Verhandlungen führten zur Befreiung der Geiseln.
examples.english: The negotiations led to the liberation of the hostages.

examples.german: Die neue Technologie kann uns von vielen Aufgaben befreien.
examples.english: The new technology can free us from many tasks.

examples.german: Der Künstler konnte seine Kreativität durch die Kunst ausdrücken und befreien.
examples.english: The artist was able to express and liberate his creativity through art.
